Topic: Draw reversible and irreversible changes (ice melting vs. egg cooking)
Evidence Statements: The student can include a drawing showing the characteristics of ice before and after melting, and then refreezing.
The student can include a drawing showing the characteristics of an egg before and after cooking.
The student can depict ice melting into water and refreezing into ice as a reversible change.
The student can depict cooking an egg as an irreversible change.
The student can use drawings to demonstrate how the heating or cooling caused these changes.
The student can explain through their drawings whether the changes are reversible or irreversible.
